description:
(T1)  Lawson's Cypress(Chaemcyparis x lawsoniana)-reduce height by 4.5m to suitable union; crown lift removing lowest branches by 1.5m on outbound side

(T2) Bay(Laurus nobilis)-reduce crown height by 1.5m to suitable growth points ensuring crown regrowth in rounded form; cut back from neighbouring studio to ensure 1m separation; trim back sides to ensure balance 'lollipop' shape and form

(T3) Magnolia(M.soulangea -reduce crown by 25%(1m) to suitable growth points
-reduce lateral branches to match, shape and balance

(T4) Evergreen Magnolia(M.grandiflora)-reduce crown by 25%(1m) to suitable growth points; reduce lateral branches to allow greater clearance from T3 to match, shape and balance

(T5) - Silver Birch(Betula pendula)-reduce crown by 25%(1.75m) to suitable growth points; reduce lateral branch length to match, shape and tidy

(G1) - 2x Cherry Laurel(Prunus laurosiferus)- remove 2x stems close to front of bed ; remove LH stem(with trellis piece attached near shed)

Overhanging rear path Various species-cut back all branch growth overhanging path by up to 1.5m incl.3x cypress trees
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
